DataElement.preferredName: Laboratory Specimen Within Specified Range Study Eligiblity Criterion Type Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A y/n/na/unk indicator whether a specified laboratory value/result is within a specified or indicated range for eligibility.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Laboratory Specimen Within Specified Range Study Eligiblity Criterion Type Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products._A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis._On the inside; contained in._Clearly and explicitly stated._The difference between the lowest and highest numerical values; the limits or scale of variation._An indication as to whether the criteria applied to a subject or case established that the subject should be included in or excluded from a study, trial or arm.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Laboratory; a workplace for the conduct of scientific research.:A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

Concepts.definition: A facility equipped and competent to conduct scientific experiments, observations, tests, investigations, and/or to manufacture chemicals or medical products.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.

An indication as to whether the criteria applied to a subject or case established that the subject should be included in or excluded from a study, trial or arm.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.
